meanings.definition: In a way that is incapable of producing any useful result
meanings.sent1: She tried futilely to fix the broken toy.
meanings.sent2: He searched futilely for his lost keys in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased its tail futilely, never catching it.
meanings.sent4: The student studied futilely for the test, not understanding the material.
meanings.sent5: The bird pecked futilely at the hard ground for worms.

meanings.definition: In a way that is pointless or ineffective
meanings.sent1: The detective searched futilely for clues at the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: She argued futilely with her brother about sharing the toy.
meanings.sent3: The chef added salt futilely to the already salty soup.
meanings.sent4: The runner sprinted futilely towards the finish line, knowing he was too far behind.
meanings.sent5: The teacher spoke futilely to the noisy class, unable to regain their attention.
